results.title: Assassin of youth
results.creator_credit: Elmer Clifton, Leo McCarthy and B C M Productions
results.brief_description: Joan is a good-natured teenager who, along with her sister, is set to receive her grandmother’s inheritance. When her grandmother is run over by a driver under the influence of marijuana, a reporter is sent to investigate. Meanwhile Joan’s scheming cousin Linda, intent on receiving the money herself, determines to have Joan dis-inherited by ruining her clean-cut reputation. The reporter on the case, who has fallen for Joan, discovers that Linda is a drug peddler and that Joan’s sister has become addicted to marijuana. “Assassin of youth” is an anti-drug teen propaganda movie typical of the 1930s. A fairly stilted and straightforward morality drama, this film has an almost transparent agenda, is patriarchal, traditionalist and simplistic in its politics. Nevertheless the film is a curiosity that is telling about the values of the era and perceived threat that teenagers under the influence posed to the status quo. Cast includes Luana Walters, Arthur Gardner, Fay McKenzie, Michael Owen, Dorothy Short, Dorothy Vaughan, Earl Dwire.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elmer Clifton, Leo McCarthy and B C M Productions

results.title: At the front: 1939-1945
results.creator_credit: Annice Vass and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: A compilation of Cinesound and Movietone Newsreels featuring footage from World War II including Prime Minister Robert Menzies’ declaration of war in 1939, the AIF at Benghazi, the Coral Sea Victory, the Australian Women’s Army Service and other momentous events including famous war footage shot by Damian Parer.

results.title: Narritjin in Canberra
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Narritjin Maymuru (A)”.
The film shows Narritjin and Banapana and their families at work in their ANU studio and later an exhibition of their work. In 1978 Narritjin Maymuru and his son Banapana were awarded fellowships as Visiting Artists to the Faculty of Arts at the Australian National University in Canberra. This program shows Narritjin and Banapana and their families at work in their A.N.U. studio. With anthropologist Howard Morphy, Narritjin conducts a seminar session for anthropology students. He explains his technique of bark painting and discusses some of the meanings behind the paintings. At the end of their stay in Canberra, Narritjin and Banapana hold an exhibition of their Manggalili art.

results.title: My country, Djarrakpi
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Narritjin Maymuru (A)”.
In this program, Narritjin Maymuru talks about his land at Djarrakpi, one of the most important sacred sites of his Manggalili clan. The film is set into two contrasting contexts. At an exhibition of his paintings at the Australian National University in Canberra, Narritjin explains the meaning behind a bark painting of Djarrakpi; then on the wind-swept sand dunes of Djarrakpi itself he explains the significance of some of the actual features of the landscape. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Narritjin Maymuru
results.creator_credit: Philip Robertson, Ian Dunlop and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Narritjin Maymuru is a respected aboriginal artist. This series of films profiles the man and his work, as well as looking at the traditional way of life he and his family follow at Djarrakpi near Yirrkala in the Northern Territory. Photography is by Dean Semler.

results.title: At the canoe camp
results.creator_credit: Philip Robertson, Ian Dunlop and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Narritjin Maymuru (A)”.
Narritjin Maymuru is leader of the Manggalili clan of northeast Arnhem Land. Covers the daily life of Narritjin and his family at a camp in the bush. Shows the making of dug out canoes. Photography by Dean Semler.

results.title: Astrology: strictly supernatural
results.creator_credit: Justin Hardy, Ludo Graham, Kaki Kirby, Stuart B Rekant, Cafe Productions and Non Fiction Films
results.brief_description: A fascinating introduction to the history and practice of Astrology. Includes interviews with astrologers talking about astrology and the history of astrology. By looking at the astrological charts of famous people (such as J.F. Kennedy and Ronald Reagan) we see how astrologers put together a chart then interpret it to give people valuable information about patterns in their life or behaviour. Explains how a the planets influence human life on Earth and how people have consulted with astrologers for over seven thousand years. Also considers the debate between traditional scientists and astrologers over the validity of Astrology as a science. Narrated by Christopher Lee.

results.title: Astroboy 17
results.creator_credit: Carl Battaglia, Del Lewis, Nihon Terebi and Tezuka Productions
results.brief_description: Three epsiodes of the adventures of the boy robot Astro created by Osamu Tezuka. The titles include: “Robio and Robiette”; Robio and Robiette are star crossed lovers as their families, the Globes and the Chariots are sworn enemies; “The Return of Queen Cleopatra”; Astro is entrusted with the royal staff of Queen Cleopatra by a modern Caesar; “The Death balloon”; Astro is incorrectly blamed for an army of floating bombs that look exactly like him and threaten to destroy the city.

results.title: Astroboy 16
results.creator_credit: Carl Battaglia, Del Lewis, Nihon Terebi and Tezuka Productions
results.brief_description: Three epsiodes of the adventures of the boy robot Astro created by Osamu Tezuka. The titles include: “Uran falls in love”; Uran befriends a funny looking robot who won’t go away; “The Hijacked airship”; Astro’s class are competing to win a trip aboard the world’s biggest airship, the Memorial. All they have to do is write about dreams; “The Secret of bee city”; Uran and Astro come across a mysterious boy when they visit Bee Island, who leads them to all sorts of dangerous discoveries.

results.title: Astroboy 15
results.creator_credit: Carl Battaglia, Del Lewis, Nihon Terebi and Tezuka Productions
results.brief_description: Three epsiodes of the adventures of the boy robot Astro created by Osamu Tezuka. The titles include: “The Robot stuntman”; on a tour of Hollywood studios Uran discovers that stuntman Tom Stanton is actually using a tiny robot named Sam to perform his stunts; “The Light ray robot”; Skunk steals the Light Ray robot, winner of the best robot of the year; “The Man-made solar sphere”; a strange accident sets off a mystery involving a powerful man-made solar sphere. Detective Shalock Holmespan is intrigued and becomes Dr Elefun, original creator of the sphere. Astro replaces Shalock Holmespan and a race begins to find the location of the sphere.
